Posts.Content: Hi Ellen Thank you for yor response...So pleased you had a good response. Fingers crossed the chemo is not to rough.
Posts.Title: Confused about type of chemotherapy for Breast cancer

Posts.Content: Hi Iam 48 yrs old, I was diagnosed with breast cancer on 27 Nov. Ive had lumpectomy followed by axillary clearence. I was told I needed Chemotherapy, as Iam stage 2 and it was in the first sentinel lymph node. Had 17 removed intotal. On visiting unit for pre assessement for chemotherapy I was told I would receive epirubin and cyclophosphamide.  I was so scared and confused I forgot to ask a lot of questions. The nurse at the unit was so pre occupied with other things as she kept disappearing. I came home and I have read so much including the past posts but not sure why I am not reciving flouracil (FEC). I feel in the last month I ve been pulled apart and past from pillar to post. Ive no breast care nurse and the first session is Monday. I am feeling lost....... Can anyone help?
Posts.Title: Confused about type of chemotherapy for Breast cancer

Posts.Content: Thank you..... That helps...trying to keep upbeat...feel this is the only place that understands!
Posts.Title: Confused about type of chemotherapy for Breast cancer

Posts.Content: Thank you very much for your relplies. I expected 3 monthly checks then 6 months just seems strange Iam on Tamoxifen but my BC nurse is not very good but she comes with surgeon so I cant change. I will read the booklet thank you again
Posts.Title: Whats the normal follow up after treatment finishes.

Posts.Content: Can anyone tell me what the normal follow up is with oncologist and surgeon after radiotherapy finished in July, surgery last December. I saw the surgeon earlier than required October instead of December due to a new lump (scar tissue)  but she doesnt want to see me until next june and I saw the oncologist for the first time since treatment finished in October and he said see you in a year. Thank you.
Posts.Title: Whats the normal follow up after treatment finishes.
